comment: If the metric ` D ` is "strongly finer" than ` C ` (meaning that there is a positive real constant ` R ` such that ` C ( x , y ) <_ R x. D ( x , y ) ` ), then ` D ` generates a finer topology. (Using this theorem twice in each direction states that if two metrics are strongly equivalent, then they generate the same topology.)
